item.description:
Inception meets Men In Black: surreal and dreamlike
You are Mystery Agents, individuals employed by The Company. Your work uniform is: Pajamas. Why? Because your job is to go to sleep... and, though a combination of holistic hoopty nonsense and pharmaceuticals, enter the collective dream of humanity - a place called Blue City. Once there, your dream selves, garbed in the official Imposing Black Suit-And-Tie (Sunglasses optional), embark on missions on behalf of The Company - either research expeditions to parts of blue city previously unexplored, assignments to take out a Hostile Personality (These are hostile, monstrous dream characters that were apparently the cause of all criminal psychotic behavior in humanity - each criminal has a corresponding Hostile Personality in Blue City that caused their actions, and when it is destroyed, the criminal becomes a productive and normal member of society once more), or other, more mysterious actions. In a dream, success is easy, and the only health meter is your heart rate - but beware, for the longer you remain, the weirder things will get...

This is the April installment of our series of one-shot RPG experiences to be offered monthly over the course of 2011. Each month will feature a different GM running a new game. This month's GM is Konstantin.

Got a game on your shelf that you've been itching to run, but your regular group just isn't interested? Why not run it for us at the Role-Playing Fellowship of Greater Boston! We want to continue running one-shot games throughout 2011, and you can help!
